t: Isaiah 2
The Mountain of the Lord
The*p word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

It*pn shall come to pass in the latter days that*ld the mountain of the house of the Lord*s shall*ln be established as the highest of the mountains, and*ld shall be lifted up above the hills; and*ln all the nations shall flow to it,

and*ld many peoples shall come, and say: “Come,*ln let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s to*ld the house of the God of Jacob, that*ln he may teach us his ways and*ld that we may walk in his paths.” For*ln out of Zion shall go forth the law, and*ld the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

He*ln shall judge between the nations, and*ld shall decide disputes for many peoples; and*ln they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and*ld their spears into pruning hooks; nation*ln shall not lift up sword against nation, neither*ld shall they learn war anymore.
O*pn house of Jacob, come,*ld let us walk in*ld the light of the Lord.*s
The Day of the Lord

For*pn you have rejected your people, the*ld house of Jacob, because*ln they are full of things from the east and*ld of fortune-tellers like the Philistines, and*ld they strike hands with the children of foreigners.
Their*ln land is filled with silver and gold, and*ld there is no end to their treasures; their*ln land is filled with horses, and*ld there is no end to their chariots.
Their*ln land is filled with idols; they*ld bow down to the work of their hands, to*ld what their own fingers have made.
So*ln man is humbled, and*ld each one is brought low— do*ld not forgive them!
Enter*ln into the rock and*ld hide in the dust from*ln before the terror of the Lord,*s and*ld from the splendor of his majesty.
The*ln haughty looks of man shall be brought low, and*ld the lofty pride of men shall be humbled, and*ln the Lord*s alone will be exalted in that day.
For*pn the Lord*s of hosts has a day against*ld all that is proud and lofty, against*ld all that is lifted up— and it shall be brought low;
against*ln all the cedars of Lebanon, lofty*ld and lifted up; and*ld against all the oaks of Bashan;
against*ln all the lofty mountains, and*ld against all the uplifted hills;
against*ln every high tower, and*ld against every fortified wall;
against*ln all the ships of Tarshish, and*ld against all the beautiful craft.
And*ln the haughtiness of man shall be humbled, and*ld the lofty pride of men shall be brought low, and*ld the Lord*s alone will be exalted in that day.
And*ln the idols shall utterly pass away.

And*ln people shall enter the caves of the rocks and*ld the holes of the ground, from*ln before the terror of the Lord,*s and*ld from the splendor of his majesty, when*ld he rises to terrify the earth.
In*pn that day mankind will cast away their*ld idols of silver and their idols of gold, which*ln they made for themselves to worship, to*ld the moles and to the bats,
to*ln enter the caverns of the rocks and*ld the clefts of the cliffs, from*ln before the terror of the Lord,*s and*ld from the splendor of his majesty, when*ld he rises to terrify the earth.
Stop*ln regarding man in*ld whose nostrils is breath, for*ld of what account is he?
